case_title: Muhammad Hayat vs Secretary Social Welfare, Women Development and Special Education Department, Government of Balochistan, Quetta and another
respondant: Secretary Social Welfare, Women Development and Special Education Department, Government of Balochistan, Quetta
Director Social Welfare, Directorate of Social Welfare Women Division Special Education Government of Balochistan
complaint_summary: The appellant challenged the withdrawal of his appointment order dated 14.12.2003 and subsequent termination on 20.12.2004, seeking reinstatement with back benefits.
investigation_summary: The appellant was initially reinstated by the Secretary Social Welfare after his first termination. The Provincial Ombudsman directed reinstatement in 2009, but this was overturned by the Governor of Balochistan in 2011, leading to the current appeal.

judgment_summary.reason_for_dismissal: Non-compliance with mandatory conditions under Section 4, Proviso (a) of Balochistan Service Tribunal Act, 1974.

legal_arguments: Non-compliance with Section 4, Proviso (a) of the Balochistan Service Tribunal Act, 1974
Case-law referred by appellant (2011 P.L.O (C.S) page 526) deemed inapplicable
citations: Gohram Soomro Vs. Secretary Ministry of Education

legal_terms.Proviso: A clause in a statute or contract that qualifies or modifies the main provision.

words_and_phrases.Temporary appointment: An appointment that is not permanent and can be terminated at any time.

legal_points.mandatory_conditions: Departmental appeal must be filed before approaching the Tribunal.

summary_vector_notes: The appellant's appeal was dismissed due to procedural non-compliance with Section 4 of the Balochistan Service Tribunal Act, 1974. The Tribunal found that the appellant failed to file a departmental appeal before approaching the Tribunal, rendering the appeal inadmissible. The appellant's temporary appointment was also deemed terminable at any time, and the case-law cited by the appellant was found irrelevant.
